message_1:
Two players, A and B, are playing the Matching Pennies game, where each player chooses either "heads" or "tails" simultaneously. If they match, player A wins $1 from player B. If they don't match, player B wins $1 from player A. Suppose that player A plays "heads" with probability p and player B plays "heads" with probability q. 

What value of p should player A choose to maximize their expected winnings if player B always chooses "heads"?
message_2: If player B always chooses "heads," that means q = 1. To maximize their expected winnings, player A should also choose "heads" every time to match player B's choice. Therefore, the value of p should be 1.
